title.value: DyG2Vec: Representation Learning for Dynamic Graphs with Self-Supervision
title.justification: The paper introduces a method called DyG2Vec for representation learning on dynamic graphs using self-supervision.
title.quote: To address these limitations, we present DyG2Vec, an SSL-compatible, efficient model for representation learning on dynamic graphs.

extractions.description: This paper presents DyG2Vec, a model designed for self-supervised representation learning on dynamic graphs. The model utilizes a window-based mechanism to generate task-agnostic node embeddings for forecasting future interactions. It aims to address the incompatibility of existing state-of-the-art models with the self-supervised learning paradigm and to improve the efficiency of training and inference.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to validate the performance and efficiency of the DyG2Vec model on multiple benchmark datasets, comparing it with state-of-the-art baselines.
type.quote: Experimental results for 7 benchmark datasets indicate that DyG2Vec outperforms SoTA baselines on future link prediction and dynamic node classification in terms of performance and speed.

name.justification: The paper focuses on learning efficient and robust representations of nodes in dynamic graphs.
name.quote: To address these limitations, we present DyG2Vec, an SSL-compatible, efficient model for representation learning on dynamic graphs.

name.justification: The primary method discussed and evaluated in the paper revolves around self-supervised learning (SSL) mechanisms.
name.quote: The novelty of our model lies in its compatibility with SoTA SSL approaches.

name.justification: The paper focuses on representation learning specifically for dynamic graphs, tackling challenges such as fine-grained temporal motifs and evolving graph structures.
name.quote: Our goal is to learn a model f that maps the input graph to a representation space. The model is a pre-trainable encoder-decoder architecture, f = (gθ , dγ ). The encoder gθ maps a dynamic graph to node embeddings H ∈ R N ×D ; the decoder dγ performs a task-specific prediction given the embeddings.

name.justification: DyG2Vec is the primary model proposed and evaluated in this paper for representation learning on dynamic graphs.
name.quote: To address these limitations, we present DyG2Vec, an SSL-compatible, efficient model for representation learning on dynamic graphs.

is_contributed.justification: DyG2Vec is the novel model introduced by the authors in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we propose DyG2Vec, a novel encoder-decoder model for continuous-time dynamic graphs.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed during the experimental evaluation.
is_executed.quote: Experimental results for 7 benchmark datasets indicate that DyG2Vec outperforms SoTA baselines on future link prediction and dynamic node classification in terms of performance and speed, particularly in medium- and long-range forecasting.

is_compared.justification: DyG2Vec is compared to several state-of-the-art baseline models, such as DyRep, JODIE, TGAT, TGN, and CaW.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results for 7 benchmark datasets indicate that DyG2Vec outperforms SoTA baselines on future link prediction and dynamic node classification in terms of performance and speed.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference paper for the DyG2Vec model itself.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To address these limitations, we present DyG2Vec, an SSL-compatible, efficient model for representation learning on dynamic graphs.

name.justification: Reddit is one of the benchmark datasets used to evaluate DyG2Vec's performance in the paper.
name.quote: Datasets: We use 7 real-world datasets: Wikipedia, Reddit, MOOC, and LastFM (Kumar et al., 2019); SocialEvolution, Enron, and UCI (Wang et al., 2021b).

name.justification: Pytorch was used as the primary deep learning framework for implementing DyG2Vec and conducting the experiments.
name.quote: We train our model using the Pytorch framework (Paszke et al., 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: To credit the main Pytorch library used in the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We train our model using the Pytorch framework (Paszke et al., 2019).

name.justification: Pytorch Geometric was used for dynamic graph data handling and implementing the GNN encoder architecture for DyG2Vec.
name.quote: The dynamic graph data and GNN encoder architecture are implemented using Pytorch Geometric (Fey & Lenssen, 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: Fast graph representation learning with PyTorch Geometric
referenced_paper_title.justification: To credit the Pytorch Geometric library used in implementing the graph-based components of DyG2Vec.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The dynamic graph data and GNN encoder architecture are implemented using Pytorch Geometric (Fey & Lenssen, 2019).
